item.title: 79,000 pass September 2018 board exams for teachers - ABS CBN News
item.description:
ABS CBN News

MANILA- A total of 79, 212 passed the licensure examination for teachers given last September, the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) announced Friday. The PRC said 18,409 elementary teachers out of 90,750 examinees and 60,803 secondary teachers out of 126,582 examinees passed the exams. Of the elementary teachers who passed, 17,200 are first timers and 1,209 are repeaters. For the secondary teachers, 52,453 passers are first timers and 8,350 are repeaters. Rhea Joy Yebes Genson from the University of Southeastern Philippines- Davao City topped the licensure exams for elementary teach...

item.title: Speech pathologists soon required to take board exam - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Speech pathologists soon required to take board exam  SunStar Philippines

SPEECH language pathologists in the country may soon have to take a licensure examination and comply with other measures aimed at professionalizing the sector after the House of Representatives, voting 170-0, approved on third and final reading the bill seeking to regulate the profession. House Bill 8529, or the “Speech Language Pathology Act”, seeks to “promote the development of a corps of competent, world class and globally competitive speech language pathologists” through the establishment of mechanisms, safeguards, and procedures for the development of the profession in the country." I...

item.title: 3 graduates from Cebu in top 10 - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
3 graduates from Cebu in top 10  Sun.Star Philippines

TWO graduates from a state college topped the Licensure Examination for Teachers that was held last Nov. 28. Ian Christian Cosido placed fourth with a rating of 89.2 while Flordeliz Joy Pansag placed ninth with a rating of 88.20 percent. Both graduated from the Cebu Normal University (CNU). Javee Cose Armamento, a graduate of the University of San Carlos, placed eighth with a rating of 88.4 percent. CNU’s College of Education dean Dr. Filomena Dayagbil said she was happy with the results. She said they expected it since they’ve produced several topnotchers over the years. Affirmation “It’s ...

item.title: Cebu grad ranks 1st in Mechanical Engineering exam - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Cebu grad ranks 1st in Mechanical Engineering exam  Sun.Star Philippines

A GRADUATE of the University of Cebu Lapu-Lapu and Mandaue (UCLM) topped the March 2017 Mechanical Engineering Licensure Examination. Brylle Gilbuena ranked first in the licensure examination with a rating of 88.10 percent. He is the only graduate in Cebu who belongs to the top 10. Gilbuena is followed by Niño Rey Jacoba Caraig, a Polytechnic University of the Philippines - Maragondon graduate, with a rating of 87.80 percent. Ariel Pulmon Conversion of Mindanao State University - Iligan Institute of Technology landed third with a rating of 87.45 percent. Four students from Batangas State Un...

item.title: CTU main campus grad 6th in licensure exam - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
CTU main campus grad 6th in licensure exam  Sun.Star Philippines

STUDY and prayers proved to be a perfect combination for Rusty Villadolid Lapus, who ranked sixth in the latest licensure exam for civil engineering released by the Professional Regulations Commission last Friday. Villadolid, a cum laude graduate of the Cebu Technological University-main campus, immediately thought of God when he learned about the good news from his brother. “Although, I knew that I did my part by studying, I still never forget to pray to Him to help me achieve my dreams,” Villadolid said in Cebuano. The 21-year-old Toledohanon admitted that he was just a typical, carefree ...

item.title: 13 Cebu grads in top 10 of PT, OT board exams - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
13 Cebu grads in top 10 of PT, OT board exams  Sun.Star Philippines

THIRTEEN Cebu graduates topped the August 2017 Physical and Occupational Therapist Licensure Examination released by the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) on Tuesday, August 8. For the Physical Therapist exams, Bret Tipay Pelesco of Velez College got the highest score with 86.45 percent, while Daniel Dominick Go Te of Cebu Doctors' University (CDU) and Mitchel Vincent Abella Antigua of Velez College got the third and fifth place, respectively. Te got 86.00 percent, while Antigua with 85.55 percent. For the Occupational Therapist exams, Gennelyn Lagulay Ariosa of Velez College landed ...

item.title: Architects group president to strengthen professional programs - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Architects group president to strengthen professional programs  Sun.Star Philippines

CITY OF SAN FERNANDO -- United Architects of the Philippines (UAP) Angeles City Chapter president Andy Gulapa on Sunday, May 7, vowed to support fellow architects to earn points under the Continuing Professional Development (CPD) program as required by the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) for the renewal of licences. According to PRC, the CPD as mandatory requirement in the renewal of professional license under Section 10 of R.A. 10912 shall be implemented after the effectivity of the Implementing Rules and Regulations (IRR) which will be in March 2017. Gulapa said that their group ...

item.title: The US States With The Most (and Least) Number of Registered Architects - ArchDaily
item.description:
The US States With The Most (and Least) Number of Registered Architects  ArchDaily

© ArchDaily As architects around the country gather for the 2017 AIA Convention in Orlando, the National Council of Architectural Registration Boards (NCARB) has decided to share some initial results from their 2016 nationwide Survey of Architectural Registration, specifically, the number of architects licensed in each state. The data tracks both the number of resident licenses and reciprocal licenses (licenses for a particular state held by a resident of another state). The 2016 survey found that the number of architects working in the US has held steady, and that architects are working ac...

item.title: PRC bares licensure exams in Davao - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
PRC bares licensure exams in Davao  Sun.Star Philippines

THE Professional Regulatory Commission (PRC)-Davap released on Friday, December 23, the list of schedules of the different Board Licensure Examinations, which will be conducted in Davao City in 2017. PRC-Davap executive officer Lawyer May Suzanne Puentespina-Ciudadano said, in a press statement that the list of schedules will serve as guide for all its clientele in Southern Mindanao. The commission released the dates of examinations including the opening of online processing and the deadlines for filing of applications. For January 2017, board examinations for architects are set on January ...

item.title: USC graduate tops Aug. 2017 pharmacist licensure exam - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
USC graduate tops Aug. 2017 pharmacist licensure exam  Sun.Star Philippines

A CEBUANO graduate of the University of San Carlos (USC) topped the August 2017 Pharmacist Licensure Examination. The list of successful examinees released by the Professional Regulations Commission (PRC) showed that Jannylene Rose Tolentino Chua ranked first, with a rating of 91.10 percent. Kimberly Tan Lomantas of the University of the Immaculate Conception-Davao ranked second with a rating of 91.05. Chua is the lone graduate of a Cebu school who landed in the top 10, which was dominated by graduates of the University of the Philippines-Manila and the University of Santo Tomas. Chua, 20, ...

item.title: Briones: Breath of fresh air - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Briones: Breath of fresh air  Sun.Star Philippines

YOU must have come across the story of Erwin Macua on Facebook. Or read about his incredible journey in the newspaper. Or seen him on TV. To those who don’t know, he’s the guy who recently received his diploma for a baccalaureate degree in General Education, cum laude, from the St. Theresa’s College (STC). So why has he been garnering much attention? Well, you have the school’s students and alumni to blame for that. They’ve been heaping praises on the man they call Kuya Erwin in social media. The father of three is a security guard at the school for 17 years. In the last three years, he jug...

item.title: 2 University of Mindanao grads top criminology board - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
2 University of Mindanao grads top criminology board  Sun.Star Philippines

ONE criminology graduate from the University of Mindanao ranked first in the Criminologist Licensure Examination in June, while another ranked fourth. Gander Quillip from the University of Mindanao (UM)-Digos College topped the exam with an 88.40 percent rate, while Joel Quibol from University of Mindanao (UM)-Tagum College ranked fourth with 87.90 percent. At second place is Matthew Solomon from ICCT Colleges Foundation with 88.35 percent, followed by John Carlo Fetalvero from Bestlik College of the Philippines at third place with 87.95 percent. Ambot Agway from Maila Rosario College Tugue...

item.title: Cebu grad ranks 4th in Architecture Licensure Exam - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Cebu grad ranks 4th in Architecture Licensure Exam  Sun.Star Philippines

A UNIVERSITY of San Carlos-Talamban Campus graduate ranked fourth in the January 2017 Architecture Licensure Board Exam held in Manila, Cebu, Baguio and Legaspi last January 27 and 29. Keshia Stephanie Lim garnered a score of 82.30 percent in the examination and the only Cebuana to be included in the top ten list. Here is the full list of the board passers released by the Professional Regulation Commission on Friday: Luiz Marko Silang of the University of the Philippines-Diliman got the top one spot with a score of 83.70 percent. (SunStar Philippines)

item.title: Davao grad ranks 2nd in Pharmacy Licensure Examination - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Davao grad ranks 2nd in Pharmacy Licensure Examination  Sun.Star Philippines

A GRADUATE of the University of the Immaculate Conception in Davao City ranked second among the 2,784 who passed out of the 5,079 who took the August 2017 Pharmacist Licensure Examination, while San Pedro College was ranked No. 5 among all schools offering BS Pharmacy in the country. Kimberly Tan Lomantas garnered 91.05 percent to rank second only to Jannylene Rose Tolentino Chua of the University of San Carlos (USC) in Cebu who got 91.1 percent. Lomantas shared second place with Genmar Cyrus Sael Pasion of the University of the Philippines-Manila. At third is another from University of the...

item.title: 2 SLU grads among Social Worker board topnotchers - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
2 SLU grads among Social Worker board topnotchers  Sun.Star Philippines

TWO GRADUATES of Saint Louis University (SLU) are among the Top 10 of the July 2017 Social Worker licensure examination. Tracee Joy Sab-it Guinyawan placed fourth with a rating of 84.50 percent while Amy Angeli Bongaoil Cabansi is in ninth place with 84.00 percent rating. SLU had a 90.91 percent passing rate with 140 passers out of the 154 examinees. The Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) announced 3,951 out of 5,997 passed the Social Worker Licensure Examination given by the Board for Social Workers in the cities of Manila, Baguio, Cagayan de Oro, Cebu, Davao, Iloilo, Legazpi, Lucena...

item.title: Cebu grad ranks 6th in Civil Engineering exam - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Cebu grad ranks 6th in Civil Engineering exam  Sun.Star Philippines

A GRADUATE of the Cebu Technological University (CTU) - Main (former CSCST) topped the 2017 Civil Engineering Licensure Examination. Rusty Villadolid Lapus ranked 6th with a rating of 92.85 percent. The licensure exam was given on May 2017. Villadolid is the only graduate from Cebu who made it to the top 10. Hisham Adiong Sacar from Far Eastern University (FEU) - Institue of Technology (former FEU-East Asia College) got the first spot with a rating of 94.60 percent. The Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) announced on its website that 2,514 out of 6,998 passed the May 2017 Civil Engine...

item.title: Baguio grad tops Architect Licensure Exam - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Baguio grad tops Architect Licensure Exam  Sun.Star Philippines

TWO graduates from Saint Louis University (SLU) in Baguio City topped the June 2017 Architect Licensure Examination released on Wednesday, June 28. Jefferson Ventura ranked first with 84.70 passing rate while Levy Santos Canaleta made it to the top six with an average of 82.50. Here is the complete list of passers who garnered the 10 highest places in the exam: Examinees who garnered the 10 highest places in the Architect Licensure Examination by Sun.Star Philippine news on Scribd Here is the complete list of passers: Full list of successful examinees by Sun.Star Philippine news on Scribd T...

item.title: 4 Cebuano grads top Civil Engineer Licensure Examination - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
4 Cebuano grads top Civil Engineer Licensure Examination  Sun.Star Philippines

FOUR Cebuano graduates made it to the top 10 of the November 2016 Civil Engineer Licensure Examination. Three graduates from the University of San Carlos were included in the top ten, namely, Samuel Eliezer Yu Uy ranked second with 92.75 percent, Selina Dianne King Bernardo at third place with 92.65 percent, and Franz Josef Jucom Ceniza at 10th place garnering 91.45 percent passing rate. On the ninth place is Jeremias Yang Marquez Jr. of Cebu Institute of Tecnology-University with 91.50 percent. The results were announced by the Professional Regulations Commission (PRC) on Wednesday, Novemb...

item.title: 435 pass special board exam for nurses in Middle East - ABS CBN News
item.description:
435 pass special board exam for nurses in Middle East  ABS CBN News

The Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) announced that 34.66% of all examinees, or a total of 435 out of 1,255, passed the special professional licensure board exam for nurses given in September this year. The exam was given by the Board of Nursing in Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates; Al-Khobar, Jeddah and Riyadh, Kingdom of Saudi Arabia; Doha, Qatar; and Kuwait. ROLL OF SUCCESSFUL EXAMINEES HERE.

item.title: Cebu grad ranks 10th in Pharmacist licensure exam - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Cebu grad ranks 10th in Pharmacist licensure exam  Sun.Star Philippines

A GRADUATE from the University of San Carlos (USC) in Cebu City topped the recent pharmacist licensure examination. Celeste Gem Mistula Hermogenes from USC ranked 10th with a score of 92.18 percent in the examination given this month. Graduates from the University of Santo Tomas (UST) Rhys Jansen Tiu Pavon ranked first with a rating of 94.73 percent followed by fellow student, Ser Loisse Rodriguez Mortel with a rating of 93.70 percent. University of the Philippines (UP)-Manila graduate, Maria Lourdes Jacinto, got the third spot with a score of 93.60 percent. UP got the most number of studen...

item.title: Davao schools shine in board exams - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Davao schools shine in board exams  Sun.Star Philippines

DAVAO CITY throughout the years has become a center and melting pot of people from different provinces in Mindanao, mostly for one reason and that is the variety of exceptional educational programs that are being offered in the city, being home to topnotch schools with different specializations. For both parents and students, each year has always been a dilemma to find the best school offering programs that will address their needs, particularly in achieving a career of their choice. In Davao city, Ateneo de Davao University is the most preferred institution, with its high passing rates for...

item.title: Baguio boy tops nursing board exam - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Baguio boy tops nursing board exam  Sun.Star Philippines

A JEEPNEY driver’s son from Trancoville, Baguio City topped the recent Nurse Licensure Examination. Eric Carolino Jacinto of Saint Louis University shared the number one spot with Faith Calzado Rutagines of the University of Santo Tomas in the recently released results of the November Nurse Licensure Examination with a rating of 86.60 percent. The 21-year-old Baguio native led the 170 new nurses produced by SLU which is the second top performing schools in the recent examinations. Jacinto, the second of four children of driver who manages his jeepney and a housewife, was a consistent honor ...

item.title: It's not the grades - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
It's not the grades  Sun.Star Philippines

SOCIETY tends to label us, that’s just how the system works. Like if you are in school, people would define you based on your grades. But Gino Arvin Baguio Santos, a proud Dabawenyo, begs to disagree as he did not let his school performance define him as a person. He instead chose to dream big and make that dream a reality. Santos, 23, has always described himself as an average person and student. He has never been a Dean’s Lister. He didn't even graduate Cum Laude, Magna Cum Laude or Summa Cum Laude, he confessed. But by believing that he can do more than what other people see him and that...

item.title: SLU is top performing Med Tech school - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
SLU is top performing Med Tech school  Sun.Star Philippines

SAINT LOUIS University (SLU) recently topped the recent Medical Technologist Licensure Examination in the country. The Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) announced SLU had a 100 percent passing rate in the Med Tech examination given February 2017. All of the 292 examinees from SLU passed with four of them in the top 10. The topnotchers are David Marco Abaya Bildan which ranked second with a rating of 90.60 percent, Arnold Joseph Octaviano Geronimo ranked fifth with 89.50 percent, Renz Michael Hart Velasco Bautista placed seventh with 89.20 percent, and while at 10th place is Julie Ann...

item.title: Cebu grad places 4th in Physician Licensure Exam - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Cebu grad places 4th in Physician Licensure Exam  Sun.Star Philippines

A MEDICINE graduate of Southwestern University Matias H. Aznar Memorial College of Medicine in Cebu City placed 4th in March 2017 Physician Licensure Examination. Maude Sang-an Tabigue is the only Cebuano graduate who made it to the top 10 of the recent physician licensure exam with a rating of 87 percent. Karl Emmanuel Cueva Mercader from the University of Perpetual Help System Dalta-Las Piñas ranked first with 88.58 percent rating. The Professional Regulation Commission announced on its website that out of 1,317 examinees, 813 passed the 2017 Physician Licensure Exam given by the the Boar...

item.title: Renewal of professional license in MP set on March 18 - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Renewal of professional license in MP set on March 18  Sun.Star Philippines

BONTOC, Mountain Province – In its effort to bring services closer to the people, the Philippine Regulations Commission (PRC), in coordination with the Provincial Government of Mountain Province, will be conducting mobile outreach services to its clients in the province for their convenience at the Provincial Capitol Building on March 18. The mobile outreach service will be open from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. Public Employment Service Officer Ernesto Emilio said services to be offered are renewal of Professional Identification Cards (PIC) and licenses which expired and will expire on or before...

item.title: Southwestern graduate tops dentist licensure exams - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Southwestern graduate tops dentist licensure exams  Sun.Star Philippines

A STUDENT of Southwestern University in Cebu topped this year’s licensure examinations for dentists. Gino Arvin Baguio Santos, 23, a Davaoeño, ranked 6th in the exams with 83.03 percent mark. The Professional Regulation Commission released the results two days after the last batch of examinees took the exams last May. The PRC stated that 394 out of 402 people had passed the practical phase while 397 out of 857 had passed the written phase of the test conducted by the Board of Dentistry in Manila. He is the only one in the top ten who came from a university in the Visayas. The rest are from ...

item.title: The Regulations That Do Work - The Daily Beast
item.description:
The Regulations That Do Work  The Daily Beast

There is a clear tide turning in this country toward reducing the size of government and easing regulations that are seen as burdensome on small and large business owners. President Trump has said he will eliminate or severely curtail the activities of the EPA, and on March 27 he signed a bill overturning Obama-era education regulations. A Harvard Business Review analysis this week argues that it is DOT regulations about bumping passengers that partly led to the United Airlines fiasco last week. I am not going to weigh in on the role of government regulations in the larger sense, but I am c...

item.title: Lapu-Lapu gives cash to board, bar passers - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Lapu-Lapu gives cash to board, bar passers  Sun.Star Philippines

AT least 42 board and bar passers who live in Lapu-Lapu City received cash incentives from the Lapu-Lapu City Government last week. City Mayor Paz Radaza distributed the P5,000 check to each passers at the City Mayor’s Office conference room last Wednesday. The City thought of giving cash incentives to the passers who have brought pride to the city. An ordinance was previously approved by the City Council for such purpose. Of the 42, 13 Oponganons have passed the Licensure Examination for Teachers while five for the Bar Examinations. Five more persons are now medical technologists while fou...

item.title: AIA Pushes for Elimination of “Intern” Title for Young Architects - ArchDaily
item.description:
AIA Pushes for Elimination of “Intern” Title for Young Architects  ArchDaily

© Jim Richards For recent architecture school graduates setting off on their careers for the first time, being referred to by the traditional title of “intern” can feel a little trivializing – as a full-time employee with a completed degree and real responsibilities, the title does little to capture a new hire’s true role within the firm. Cognizant of this discrepancy, the AIA is now taking steps to eliminate the use of ‘intern,’ a term grandfathered in from the days of architectural apprenticeships and more linear paths through the architectural profession. In December of last year, the AI...

item.title: Achievers receive cash, certificates - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Achievers receive cash, certificates  Sun.Star Philippines

THE Lapu-Lapu City Government awarded 12 board examination passers and placers with cash incentives and certificates. Last Tuesday, Mayor Paz Radaza awarded eight placers and passers of different boards. Of the 12 awardees, two top 1 of the Certified Public Accountant (CPA) board examination and another top 1 of the mechanical engineering board exams received P100,000 each. Brylle Gilbuena of Barangay Gun-ob (Top 1 of March 2017 Mechanical Engineering Board Exam), Nona Casey Baring of Barangay Pajo (Top 2 of June 2017 Nursing Licensure Examination), Vianca Pearl Amores of Barangay Bankal, a...

item.title: 2 Cebuano grads top licensure exam for teachers - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
2 Cebuano grads top licensure exam for teachers  Sun.Star Philippines

(UPDATED) -- Two Cebuano graduates made it to the top 10 of the September 2016 licensure examination for teachers. The two Cebuanos who made it to the top 10 for secondary level teachers are Ian Christian Paler Cosido, who ranked 4th with 89.20 percent, and Flordeliz-Joy Pansag, who is in 9th place with 88.20 percent. Both are products of the Cebu Normal University. View the results here: Elementary level Secondary level The Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) released the results on Monday, November 28. The PRC also announced that 23,378 elementary teachers out of 77,466 examinees, an...

item.title: Helping through language training - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Helping through language training  Sun.Star Philippines

THERE’S an old adage that goes something like, “It doesn’t matter how many times you fall, what matters most is how many times you get up after each fall.” A registered nurse and now a certified International English Language Testing System (Ielts) instructor who now manages her own language institute along Quirino Street, Davao City, Resand Ezer Gaid, had been through a lot of business and career challenges before she was able to find stability in her chosen path. Rez Language Institute is currently located at Centron Building, Quirino St. corner Gen. Luna St. Res, a graduate of Bachelor o...

item.title: CIT-U grad ranks 6th in CE exam - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
CIT-U grad ranks 6th in CE exam  Sun.Star Philippines

STUDY and prayers proved to be a perfect combination for Rusty Villadolid Lapus, who ranked sixth in the latest licensure exam for civil engineering released by the Professional Regulations Commission last Friday. Villadolid, a cum laude graduate of Cebu Technological University-main campus, immediately thought of God when he learned about the good news from his brother. “I was really waiting for the result, but it was my younger brother who saw the result first while he was scrolling down his feeds on Facebook. That moment, I immediately remembered him (God) first. Although I knew that I d...

item.title: Good study habits, goal-setting helped USJ-R topnotchers - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Good study habits, goal-setting helped USJ-R topnotchers  Sun.Star Philippines

THE University of San Jose Recoletos (USJ-R) produced three topnotchers in the recent certified public accountant (CPA) licensure exam. Harold Panerio Pacaña (sixth, 91 percent) only dreamed of passing the board exam to help his parents who look up to him as their only hope. He said he never expected to land in the top 10. “I am the only hope of my parents. My father works as a family driver and my mother is a house caretaker, and they see me as their only hope who could take them out from poverty,” said Pacaña in Cebuano. On the day that the examination result was released, Pacaña shared h...

item.title: Bermudo: My goal was to be part of CPA top 5 - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Bermudo: My goal was to be part of CPA top 5  Sun.Star Philippines

EAT-SLEEP-STUDY was the only daily routine of Jessa Comar Bermudo before she took the 2017 certified public accountant (CPA) licensure examination. Bermudo ranked second in the CPA licensure exam, with a rating of 92.50. She graduated magna cum laude from the University of San Carlos-main campus last April. “Our teachers constantly remind us that every little thing that we do should be for the board exams and only for the exams. So I didn’t go out that much,” she said. The 21-year-old Cebuana realized that she had the potential when she placed third in their first comprehensive exam. “I gav...

item.title: 1st Maranaw woman tops licensure exam for teachers - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
1st Maranaw woman tops licensure exam for teachers  Sun.Star Philippines

A GRADUATE of Philippine Muslim Teachers’ College (PMTC) in Marawi City is the first Maranaw woman in the Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao (Armm) to top the licensure examination for teachers or LET. Sittie Airah Farida Abdulhalim, 20 years old, who hails from Masiu town, Lanao del Sur is on top 5 for elementary level with a rating of 87.20 percent. After Abdulhalim, 147 elementary and 19 secondary board passers also came from PMTC. The teachers took their oath before the Professional Regulatory Commission on Saturday, December 17. Life struggles were never an obstacle for Abdulhalim. “...

item.title: Gullas scion tops medicine board - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Gullas scion tops medicine board  Sun.Star Philippines

A GRANDSON of Talisay City Mayor Eduardo Gullas and brother of Rep. Gerard Anthony “Samsam” Gullas (Cebu, 1st district) and Talisay City Councilor Eduardo “Digul” Gullas III topped the September 2017 Physician Licensure examination. First in rank with the score of 90.5 percent was Vincent Edouard Anthony R. Gullas, a University of Santo Tomas graduate. Congressman Gullas posted on his Facebook page that his brother finished medical technology at Velez College in Cebu City. He said his brother also topped the Medical Technology Licensure Examination five years ago. Mark Andrian Yano, a gradu...

item.title: Working student tops engineering board - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Working student tops engineering board  Sun.Star Philippines

A WORKING student for the University of Cebu Lapu-Lapu and Mandaue campus (UCLM) brought honor to his school after ranking first in the recently concluded Mechanical Engineering Board examinations earlier this month. Brylle Pahimutang Gilbuena, 22, earned a score of 88.10 percent. He is also the only Cebuano who made it to the top 10 of the board exam, which was conducted last March 18 and 19 in the cities of Cebu and Manila. To reward his feat, UC Chancellor Candice Gotianuy gave Gilbuena a brand new car. It has been a tradition of the UC administration to give brand new cars to its topnot...

item.title: Positive sparks - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Positive sparks  Sun.Star Philippines

BOARD examinations usually drain an examinee of considerable energy, not just physically but also mentally and emotionally. That’s why escaping to the tranquil mountains of Sagada was the most perfect way to reintegrate for new Cebuana architect Keshia Stephanie Lim and her study group after months of grueling review until the actual test last January. “I remember before the trip I told my friend, ‘I hope our ride home would be a good one’ to which he replied ‘I’m confident it would be great.’” However, the architecture graduate of the University of San Carlos (USC) confided that they were ...

item.title: 3 Baguio graduates top teacher licensure exam - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
3 Baguio graduates top teacher licensure exam  Sun.Star Philippines

THREE graduates of the Saint Louis University in Baguio City were among the Top 10 during the March 2017 Licensure Examinations for Teachers (LET). In the recently released results of LET, Erin Hyja Banayat Fabrigas garnered a rating of 87.40 to take the Top 10 in the elementary level while Melanie Locano Baniwas and Racquel Abretan Luban, both with 90.20 rating, both landed 10th in the secondary level. The Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) and the Board for Professional Teachers (BPT) said 5,600 elementary teachers out of 53,915 examinees passed the exam while only 18,482 secondary ...

item.title: Wesleyan grad tops CPA board exams; UP sets 100 pct passing rate - ABS CBN News
item.description:
Wesleyan grad tops CPA board exams; UP sets 100 pct passing rate  ABS CBN News

MANILA - The Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) announced Thursday that 5,249 out of 14,390 passed the Certified Public Accountant Licensure Examination. Vhinson Jay Garcia of Wesleyan University-Philippines Cabanatuan topped the exam with a score of 94.33 percent. University of the Philippines-Diliman meanwhile emerged as the top performing school with a 100-percent passing rate. The successful examinees who garnered the 10 highest places in the October 2016 Certified Public Accountant Licensure Examination are the following: For the full list of passers, click here. The exams were g...

item.title: 2 Dabawenyos top Architect Licensure Exam - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
2 Dabawenyos top Architect Licensure Exam  Sun.Star Philippines

TWO Dabawenyos made it to the top ten passers of the Architecture Licensure Exam (ALE) for June 2017. Marion Lyndon Demaisip from the University of Mindanao-Davao City placed fourth with 82.8 percent, while Charisse Jheline Ang of Ateneo de Davao University (ADDU) ranked sixth with 82.5 percent. Topping the Architect Board exam is Jefferson Ventura from Saint Louis University with 84.70 percent, followed by Aldous Olbes from Pamantasan ng Lungsod ng Maynila (2nd, 84.30 percent), and Judy An Larin from Bulacan State University (3rd, 82.90%). Sharing the fifth spot after Demaisip are Danielin...

item.title: Provincial Board commends 2016 LET-Middle East topnotcher from Pangasinan - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Provincial Board commends 2016 LET-Middle East topnotcher from Pangasinan  Sun.Star Philippines

LINGAYEN, Pangasinan – The Provincial Board approved a resolution Monday, November 14, congratulating a Pangasinense who topped the 2016 Licensure Examination for Teacher-Secondary administered in the Middle East last September 16. The resolution, authored by all members of the Provincial Board, commended Erik Hans Lamsen Sorio for his exemplary achievement of passing the licensure exams as topnotcher and bringing honor and prestige to the province. Sorio, son of Eduardo and Adalia Sorio, graduated cum laude with the degree of Bachelor of Science in Nursing at the University of Pangasinan a...

item.title: Application for March 2017 Teachers Exam now open - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Application for March 2017 Teachers Exam now open  Sun.Star Philippines

THE Professional Regulation Commission-Baguio Regional Office is now accepting applications for the March 26, 2017 Board Licensure Examination for Teachers. Deadline for filing of application for new or first-time and repeater applicants is on January 20, 2017. For First-time applicants, requirements include original and photocopy of Transcript of Records with scanned picture and remarks, “For Board Examination Purposes”; original and photocopy of PSA/NSO-issued Birth Certificate issued in security paper;oOriginal and photocopy of PSA/NSO-issued Marriage Certificate in security paper(for ma...

item.title: 86 pass master plumber exam in Middle East - ABS CBN News
item.description:
86 pass master plumber exam in Middle East  ABS CBN News

Eighty-six examinees passed the Master Plumber Licensure Examination given by the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) in the Middle East. A total of 175 took the exam, which was given by the Board for Master Plumbers in Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates; Al-Khobar, Jeddah and Riyadh, Kingdom of Saudi Arabia; Doha, Qatar and in Kuwait in September 2016. ROLL OF SUCCESSFUL EXAMINEES HERE.

item.title: COC-Phinma criminology grads garner top spots in licensure exams - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
COC-Phinma criminology grads garner top spots in licensure exams  Sun.Star Philippines

FOR some, passing an exam--school exams, Civil Service exams, or even licensure exams--is achievement enough. Some are happy with being average and getting enough to pass the exam. But if passing an examination is already a big achievement, how much more if you made it with flying colors? The official results of this year’s Criminology Licensure Examination (CLE) were released last June 30, by the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC). And while the top spot went to Gander Suello Quillip of the University of Mindanao–Digos College who ranked first with a score of 88.40 percent rating, th...

item.title: City College of San Fernando tops teachers’ licensure exam - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
City College of San Fernando tops teachers’ licensure exam  Sun.Star Philippines

CITY OF SAN FERNANDO -- The City College of San Fernando (CCSFP) topped this year’s Licensure Examination for Teachers (LET) on secondary education besting other universities and colleges in the region. CCSFP posted a 76 percent passing rate in the LET last September 2016, which is way beyond the national passing rate of 34 percent. CCSFP, with a 48 percent passing rate, ranked fifth in elementary education. Founded in 2009, the CCSFP is among the flagship projects of the city government to provide quality and affordable education to Fernandino students. Its charter was approved by then Vic...

item.title: How this Civil Engineering Board Exam Top 4 passer plans to give back - ABS CBN News
item.description:
How this Civil Engineering Board Exam Top 4 passer plans to give back  ABS CBN News

Photo by May Diez, ABS-CBN News BUTUAN CITY - It was five days ago when Kenneth Acas learned that he passed a Civil Engineering Board Exam but he still can't believe he made it. Acas is a son of a government employee, the eldest of five siblings. He admits that before he enrolled in college, he sought a scholarship due to poverty. He later became a beneficiary of the Human Resource Management Development (HMRD) Scholarship Program of the Father Saturnino Urios University (FSUU) in Butuan City. After graduating, he reviewed for four months in Manila. For Kenneth, the exam wasn't easy. He jus...

item.title: New Agreement Allows U.S. Architects to Earn Reciprocal Licenses in Australia and New Zealand - ArchDaily
item.description:
New Agreement Allows U.S. Architects to Earn Reciprocal Licenses in Australia and New Zealand  ArchDaily

© The Shopping Sherpa via Attribution Engine. Licensed under CC BY-ND For U.S. architects, working abroad will now be easier than ever, as the National Council of Architectural Registration Boards (NCARB) has announced a new mutual recognition arrangement with the licensing authorities of Australia and New Zealand. Effective as of January 1, 2017, the agreement allows architects to earn reciprocal licenses that authorize architects to work in the two countries. “The arrangement is an exciting opportunity for architects seeking to expand their careers internationally,” said NCARB President K...

item.title: PH School of Interior Design grads top licensure exam - ABS CBN News
item.description:
PH School of Interior Design grads top licensure exam  ABS CBN News

The Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) announced Thursday that 213 out of 419 passed the Interior Designer Licensure Examination given in October 2016. The successful examinees who garnered the 10 highest places in the October 2016 Interior Designer Licensure Examination are: 1 IRENE KATHLEEN DEE DEE PHILIPPINE SCHOOL OF INTERIOR DESIGN 88.65 2 HAZEL ANNE LING TAN PHILIPPINE SCHOOL OF INTERIOR DESIGN 87.50 3 NICKA ANDAYA VENTURA UNIVERSITY OF THE PHILIPPINES-DILIMAN 86.30 4 GRACE VIDAD RYSER UNIVERSITY OF THE PHILIPPINES-DILIMAN 85.00 5 ...

item.title: Half of PH schools for teachers perform poorly in licensure exams - Rappler
item.description:
Half of PH schools for teachers perform poorly in licensure exams  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Around half of the teacher education institutions (TEIs), or schools which offer education courses for aspiring teachers in the country, have been performing poorly in the licensure examinations from 2009 to 2017. In the past 9 years, takers of the Licensure Examination for Teachers (LET) registered only a “dismal” 31% passing rate, according to a recent study by non-governmental organization Philippine Business for Education (PBEd). The study showed that 497 out of 1,024 TEIs who had graduates take the elementary examination under LET performed below the national pass...

item.title: CIT-U grad ranks 1st in Mining Engineer Licensure Exam - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
CIT-U grad ranks 1st in Mining Engineer Licensure Exam  Sun.Star Philippines

A GRADUATE from Cebu Institute of Technology-University (CIT-U) made it to the top spot of the August 2017 Mining Licensure Examination. The results were announced by the Professional Regulations Commission (PRC) on Monday, August 14. Pompeii Nikolai SubingSubing of CIT-U ranked first with an average of 90.90 percent. Philip Santi Morgia of the University of the Philippines-Diliman landed on the second spot with 89.80 percent, followed by Gelaine Chavez Cabria on the third spot with 89.55 percent. See the full list of examinees here: List of successful examinees of the August 2017 Mining En...

item.title: After passing CPA licensure test together, best friends top the Bar - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
After passing CPA licensure test together, best friends top the Bar  Sun.Star Philippines

KAREN Mae Calam and Anne Margaret Momongan have been best friends since college. They took the same course and they passed the licensure exams for Certified Public Accountants (CPA) together. Calam and Momongan, both from the University of San Carlos (USC), also studied law together. And now, they not only passed the Bar exams, they both topped it. Based on the results of the 2016 Bar Examinations, Calam ranked first with a grade of 89.05 percent, while Momongan ranked seventh, with a grade of 87.8 percent. When they heard the news, Calam and Momongan, who both work for the accounting firm ...

item.title: Cebu grad tops Medical Technologist Licensure Exam - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Cebu grad tops Medical Technologist Licensure Exam  Sun.Star Philippines

A GRADUATE of Cebu City made it into the top ten of the August 2017 Medical Technologist Licensure Examination, the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) announced on Thursday, August 31. Louis Joseph Gaviola Lafuente of Velez College made it to the ninth rank with a score of 90.10 percent. Marianne Ross Bacia Soldevilla of Notre Dame of Marbel University got the first place with 90.90 percent, while Glenn Charls Lagumbay Buelis of the University of the Immaculate Conception-Davao got the second place with a score of 90.80 percent. Cebu Doctors' University is among the country's top perf...

item.title: Former UP Maroons standout Jett Manuel passes Civil Engineering board exam - SPIN.ph
item.description:
Former UP Maroons standout Jett Manuel passes Civil Engineering board exam  SPIN.ph

FORMER University of the Philippines cager Jett Manuel earned a new title, one that he can proudly carry off the court. Call him Engineer Manuel from now on. The UP cager, who finished his collegiate career in UAAP Season 78, achieved a feat a few student-athletes have achieved, passing the recent Civil Engineering licensure exam. “I've never prepared so hard for anything in my life,” said Manuel. What's even more impressive was that Manuel had to balance attending review school and his training to prepare himself physically for the PBA draft. “I attended review classes starting last Januar...

item.title: ‘Topping exam is just the icing on the cake’ - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
‘Topping exam is just the icing on the cake’  SunStar Philippines

MARTIN Angelo Zanoria was in another timezone when he learned that not only was he going to be a doctor, but that he finished Top 2 in the 2018 Physician Licensure Examination. Zanoria was in the United States when the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) revealed the results of the September examination, where he finished second with a rating of 90.92 percent. He was surprised about placing second out of 4,542 who took the exams because his goal was simply just to pass. “I felt a sense of relief that the results were finally out considering the long delay in our examinations and what w...

item.title: Albay graduate tops Midwife Licensure Exam - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Albay graduate tops Midwife Licensure Exam  SunStar Philippines

THE Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) announced Wednesday, November 7, that 1,175 out of 2,478 examinees passed the Midwife Licensure Examination given in November this year. Topping the list of passers is a graduate of Immaculate Conception College in Albay province who got a passing rate of 90.75 percent. Here's the list of the top 10 passers: 1. Excelsia Rebeka Maree Lobete Basco of Immaculate Conception College-Albay -- 90.75 percent 2. Darlene Villanueva Mendoza of Brokenshire College Soccsksargen Inc. -- 90.30 percent 3. Gellian Labagis Alaurin of Calayan Educational Foundation...

item.title: UA launches continuing teacher education program - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
UA launches continuing teacher education program  SunStar Philippines

DO YOU want to enhance your teaching competencies and qualify for the Licensure Examination for Teachers? The University of the Assumption (UA) Graduate School of Education invites professionals and non-education graduates to take its Continuing Teacher Education Program (CTEP), an 18-unit teacher education program that provides sound theoretical foundation on professional teacher education within 5 months, from November 2018 to March 2019. Classroom discussions and examinations will be held on two Saturdays per month only, from 9:00AM to 4:00PM. The rest of the classes are online and flexi...

item.title: Tell it to SunStar: Pinoys nurses scouting for US jobs up 27% - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Tell it to SunStar: Pinoys nurses scouting for US jobs up 27%  SunStar Philippines

A TOTAL of 4,533 Filipino nurses hoping to practice their profession in America took the U.S. licensure examination for the first time from January to June this year. The number is up 27 percent versus the 3,572 Philippine-educated nurses who took America’s eligibility test, or the NCLEX, for the first time in the same six-month period in 2017. The NCLEX refers to the licensure examination either for registered nurse (RN) or for practical nurse (PN) administered by the U.S. National Council of State Boards of Nursing Inc. (NCSBN). Since passing the NCLEX is the final step in the nurse licen...

item.title: Non-LET passers undergo training on instructional competence - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Non-LET passers undergo training on instructional competence  SunStar Philippines

THE Department of Education (DepEd)-Central Luzon announced that some 1,356 non-Licensure Examination Teachers (LET) passers are set to undergo training. Those covered are Senior High School (SHS) teachers in Central Luzon and will undergo a simultaneous capacity building on enhanced instructional competence on August 20 to 22. DepEd-Central Luzon Director Beatriz Torno said the capacity building will be held in six clusters in Bulacan, Nueva Ecija, Pampanga, Tarlac, Zambales, and Bataan. “We want to keep our non-LET passers, because we have come to love our teachers. They have taught for t...
